>From: "Roland the Gunslinger" <thecode@...>

>OOC: Okay, because there was another BWRPG run by Macavity, and my most 
>mortal enemy of all time is in that one. I think it has since closed down 
>though, officially making my RPG the longest lasting. I WIN! Hahahaha! 
>Ahem, heh...
>
>   ----- Original Message -----
>   From: Legendarynemasis@...

>
>   Nope by me, an ADestroyah, and an Arsenite.
>
>   --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Roland the Gunslinger" <thecode@p...> wrote:
>   > OOC: Was that RPG run by someone named Macavity, by any chance?
>   Just wondering...
>   >
>   >   ----- Original Message -----
>   >   From: Legendarynemasis@a...
>   >   To: nbwrpg@y...
>   >   Sent: Monday, July 16, 2001 3:24 PM
>   >   Subject: Re: Kyle Stewart
>   >
>   >
>   >   OOC: We shalt not speak of the horrors of the Dark Ages of BWRPG
>   >   (another much earlier RPG that now exists partially inform of
>   >   another). Then super blasts, the destruction of the Axalon,
>   >   Trypticon! Metroplex! The Dinobots! Stasis lock Darts!!!! Yes
>   those
>   >   were the days tons of moding but it was all good and fun because
>   many
>   >   were expeirimenting and had no Idea what they were doing...
>   >
>   >   --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Soulstice Omega" <thecode@p...> wrote:
>   >   > OOC: I agree. I never had the rules explained to me when I
>   first
>   >   joined a year ago. I was new to the Internet and didn't know how
>   to
>   >   act, and besides that I started off as just a bad RPGer. Kyle
>   >   Stewart, you start off as a good one, but with the same flaw as I
>   >   originally had. Not knowing the rules. Of course, back then the
>   rules
>   >   page sucked, and it is nowhere near the grand spectacle it is
>   today.
>   >   It's not very descriptive and informative. But back to my point,
>   I
>   >   moded alot without even noticing it, and did things very similar
>   to
>   >   you, Kyle Stewart (if that's what you like to be called). I once
>   even
>   >   busted into a base and played around inside in one post because I
>   was
>   >   bored, and didn't know what I did wrong until months later!...
>   >   >
